meanings.definition: To make a high-pitched, chattering sound
meanings.sent1: The birds tweedled happily in the trees.
meanings.sent2: The teapot tweedled as it reached boiling point.
meanings.sent3: The excited children tweedled with joy at the sight of the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent4: The wind tweedled through the branches like a playful melody.
meanings.sent5: The old radio tweedled softly in the background, creating a cozy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To produce a series of short, sharp sounds
meanings.sent1: The typewriter tweedled as the writer worked on his novel.
meanings.sent2: The raindrops tweedled on the roof during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The popcorn tweedled in the microwave before it was ready to eat.
meanings.sent4: The keys of the piano tweedled under the skilled fingers of the musician.
meanings.sent5: The coins tweedled as they were dropped into the piggy bank.

meanings.definition: To utter a shrill, piercing sound
meanings.sent1: The kettle tweedled loudly to signal that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock tweedled, waking him up abruptly.
meanings.sent3: The whistle tweedled to announce the start of the race.
meanings.sent4: The excited puppy tweedled with delight when its owner returned home.
meanings.sent5: The tea kettle tweedled urgently, demanding attention before it boiled over.
